Over the last five years, the genomes of four distinct eukaryotic organisms have been fully sequenced. This includes Saccharomyces cerevisiae, a unicellular EC2, two multicellular organismS, Caenorhabditis elegans, and Drosophila melanogaster and Arabidopsisthaliana. The analysis of these major groups of organismses allows for comparative analysis (deduction) of genes and gene families across phylogenetically diverse organism species.

The use of mRNA differential display was employed to identify genes that have been altered in Pneumocystis carinii-infected hosts. The nucleotide sequence of one of the fragments displayed in the differentially determined expression corresponded to the gene encoding the rat mitochondrial ATPase 6, which is a subunit of F0F1-ATP synthases.
